review_text:
This was my 2nd time staying at Brian's place - I've stayed at a few of his other properties, as well. It's a great home base for me when I drive up from Asheville, NC, to visit my Grandma - and I can bring my ride or die, my dog River, who LOVES the big, fenced yard (I just wish there was a gate between the house and the garage so it was 100% fenced).
Brian and his co-host, Max, were INCREDIBLY helpful and accommodating this trip. I had originally booked for Sept 12-14, but then my Grandma had a medical emergency, and I needed to drive up early. Brian and Max rescheduled my reservation at no additional charge AND offered me free early check in. It made a very sad and stressful situation so much easier!
The house is super-cute and has everything you need for a short- or long-term stay! I haven't used the upstairs either time I've stayed, but it would be great for kids or other guests.

name: Keely
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
November 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
I grew up in Appleton, and my pup (River) and I took a roadtrip from NC to visit my 104 year old Grandma in her nursing home. I truly loved my stay at Mark's place, and I found myself wishing I had another night there to fully enjoy it. It was so lovely to have clean, quiet, comfortable place that I could relax in the evenings. It's located close to downtown, meaning that all delivery and ride share services are easily accessible. There's plenty of off-street parking in the driveway, which makes loading/unloading super quick and easy.
The house itself is newly remodeled, and the kitchen and main bedroom were particularly spacious. I especially appreciated the device chargers provided in the living room and bedroom, the gift of custom chocolates, and the wide selection of tea and accompaniments. I don't cook, but I found most everything I needed in the kitchen. The addition of a wine bottle stopper and some food storage options (zipper bags, containers with lids) would make it complete!
The main bathroom is serviceable, but quite small. There's a doorstop secured to the floor inside the bathroom that keeps the bathroom door from opening all the way...and it happens to be right in front of the rather tiny mirror mounted high above the sink. I found myself having to lean over to see myself in the mirror while getting ready, which was workable but less than ideal, and closing the door to have better access to the sink/mirror would have blocked out all natural light and made the bathroom feel claustrophobic. The water pressure in the shower was great, though the provided shampoo, conditioner, and soap appeared to need replacement as the liquids and solids of each had separated and begun to yellow. I brought my own products, so this wasn't an issue for me.
I didn't need to use the two bedrooms upstairs, but I did look at them briefly when I first arrived and found them to be in keeping with the listing.
The house has a large yard with a gorgeous deck (complete with string lights), and River had THE BEST time zooming through the fallen leaves! The yard is fenced, though there is no gate between the deck and the driveway, and lower half of the yard is uneven/steeply sloped. There also appeared to be sections that hadn't been mowed/maintained as recently as others, but that wasn't a barrier to our enjoyment - there was plenty of space for us to run and play. We were able to see and hear several neighbors working in their yards, but nothing terribly disruptive.
I hope to return to Mark's place the next time I visit my Grandma with my spouse!

We stayed for 6 nights to see our son off to Lawrence Uni.
Upon arrival, we immediately feel at home. I love the interior. I didn't know before that black and grey interior can be so appealing and light. The place was really clean.
There were phone charging station in many places and this is helpful for a family who uses gadgets frequently ; the kitchen utensils were complete which made it easy for us to cook easy meals anytime, complete amenities, coffee and several different types of coffee makers; the TV complete with Netflix etc;
We enjoyed sitting at the back terace and even saw a deer running to the woods one morning. The location was really good since being close to the park and Riverside means good walks for us.
We met Brian the owner on the first morning when he was checking on a painting being done outside the house. He was very friendly and we had a nice chat with him.
We surely would love to stay here again on our next visit.

In addition, my son and daughter who are Harry Potter fans LOVED IT! My son even sleeping "under the stairs in the cupboard closet" that was hilariously set up and matched the story book to a Tee. The house would make for an incredible set suitable for a Disney theme park with velvet rope restrictions so that persons touring the famous Harry Potter home could only peer into each and every themed room that was full of fantastic artifacts. Bravo!

review_text:
This is a cozy, stylishly decorated house in a quiet residential neighborhood of Appleton. Most Appleton attractions are just a 5-10 minute drive away, and there's also easy access to Oshkosh and other cities along Lake Winnebago. The TV/entertainment is hooked up to a lot of different streaming services which was a nice touch. The host was very communicative and easy to get a hold of.
Only two cons to note. One, there was hair in the shower drain when we arrived. Two, the air conditioning does not seem to reach the second floor, where the bedroom is. We stayed here in the middle of July and the second floor got uncomfortably hot, even at night. There was a ceiling fan, but we had to turn it off because it made a lot of noise.

Our recent stay at Brittany's charming Appleton, WI home was nothing short of extraordinary. Brittany, our exceptional super host, welcomed us into a delightful blend of cozy and spacious living, creating a true home away from home.
Brittany's attention to detail and hospitality were evident from the moment we stepped through the door. The highlight of our stay was the tasteful touch of greenery in every room, seamlessly integrated into the decor, adding a refreshing and tranquil ambiance.
The living areas provided a perfect balance of comfort and style, inviting relaxation. The bedrooms, thoughtfully curated and adorned, offered a serene haven for restful nights. Brittany's dedication to creating a welcoming environment was apparent in every corner.

Brittanyâ€™s house was the perfect place to relax during Lawrence Reunion weekend. The house is very close to campus, so our rentals cars were parked in the driveway all weekend!
The house is very welcoming. Bright and airy. The kitchen/dining/living open space was great for kicking our feet up and chatting the night away. The house rules are printed in a spiral bound boom on the counter - and includes restaurant recommendations, area parks and detailed instructions for the rad coffee maker.
There were four of us in the house using three bedrooms - the beds were so comfortable, we slept really well and were refreshed for our action packed days around campus.
We will definitely stay here again when back in Appleton. Thanks Brittany!

The beds were comfy, bathrooms were spacious, and the living area/kitchen were perfect for what we needed. The neighborhood was also nice and quiet.

name: Michael
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
â€œHomey Lower-Level Apartment with Private Entrance.â€ Appleton, WI June 17-20, 2022
Above the kitchen sink in Ron and Dottieâ€™s basement apartment is a plaque with a picture of perhaps 20 smiling people. The inscription speaks of family: â€œWe may not have it all together, but together we have it all.â€ Short of being adopted into their clan, we could not have felt much more welcome or cared for.
The Krausâ€™ home looks like a page out of House Beautiful magazine. Manicured lawn and sculpted garden beckoned from the street. The interior was immaculately clean and neat-as-a-pin tidy. Tastefully decorated and comfortably furnished, we lacked nothing. Blazingly fast WiFi. Hi-Def TV and Nintendo Wii for entertainment. A softly humming Danby dehumidifier kept the air circulating for comfort.
In our reservation, we had mentioned that we were observing our 25th wedding anniversary with our family in Wisconsin. Dottie surprised us with a saucer-sized carrot cake, two silver candles and matches. How sweet!
An array of snacks awaited us on the dining table, and the refrigerator was stocked with a few basics. Cookware, tableware and utensils were ready for action.
The sturdy twin beds had high quality linens and mattresses. We slept well.
The bathroom was white-glove clean, with fluffy towels with a variety of soaps, shampoos and conditioners. Extra toothbrushes were provided for absent-minded guests.
In reading the Guest Journal entries, it became obvious that the many guest before us had similar gratitude for the generous and gracious hospitality Ron and Dottie had shown us. If AirBnB had a rating beyond SuperHosts, they surely would merit it.

Keri was able to accommodate us last minute during a family emergency. she even went over before our last minute arrival to salt the driveway.
Due to the emergency, our ability to pack was limited . The extra toiletries were a life saver. Also, we regularly travel with our dogs. it was nice to see an airBnb actually felt dog friend and had dog friendly rules .
I am picky when it comes to cleaning. Keri's place met my high standards. I was impressed. Particularly for such a large place.
Lastly, though we did not stay long enough to fully enjoy the space, the house has some serious charm and is spacious. I loved the tub and the stained glass.
I recommend staying here!

Everything was very well kept and thoughtfully placed, including comfy blankets and tableware for little eaters. Highly recommended place.

The rooms were small but adequate. There is only 1 bathroom and itâ€™s very small. Can be chaotic and stressful with more than 2 people or more than 1 woman.
A train is nearby but otherwise we got very good sleep at night. The lock on the front door can be tedious, confusing and frustrating so we used the garage door opener for the remainder of our stay (keeping it in our truck).
Yee was very communicative, attentive and little personal touches to make us feel welcome and comfortable. We had everything we needed for our stay. The checkout process was by far the easiest and quickest compared to every AirBNB we have stayed at. Thank you Yee!

The house is conveniently located to seemingly everything (just ten minutes to the soccer park, a walk to the shops and restaurants on College Avenue and 25 minutes to High Cliff State Park). It was also just the right size for our family of four. There was one small repair needed during our stay so I messaged Mark, who replied immediately and had a repairman to the house the very next morning. Very much appreciated! We also appreciated the access to laundry in the basement, the Roku box connected to the TV in the living room and the cute drawing room off the upstairs bedroom. The house is an old house, with a lot of charm, and many recent updates. It kept us comfortable for our two days in Appleton!

review_text: Wonderful return visit to this very special cabin. It's so close to everything, yet somehow once you turn into the drive you are almost instantly transformed to being in the north woods. Magic! The cabin is very comfortable and well stocked, including a full kitchen, and completely met our needs with great special touches like the deck of cards we used outside on the deck. The pocket screen door is awesome; even when inside the cabin, you can leave the front door open and feel like you're outside in nature! Sadly, I ran out of time to use the kayak. haha Next visit! There was a very impressive moon shining over the river on my last night. If you want to be close to everything yet have peace and privacy in tranquil nature, this is for you!Finally, super host Amy is so warm, friendly, and responsive - from quickly answering questions to just letting you know how much she cares that you have a good stay. This is a wonderful place to stay with truly nice and caring hosts

Â·

review_text: Amazing Location, Amenities, and a Super Host! I loved my stay at this warm, welcoming, and inviting cabin on the water. It feels like the north woods - so private and peaceful - but it is actually conveniently located to everything going on in the area. A real gem. Beautiful views from inside the cabin and outside on the wrap decks. Every amenity I wanted and then some: a fully stocked kitchen (even cinnamon for my coffee), a comfy bed with extra blankets, super comfortable chairs inside and outside on the deck, and a fireplace for chilly days. I will have to use the grill and kayaks next time! Hanging out in the morning with coffee, a fire, and the water views was beyond relaxing. A work area with views and good Internet service made keeping up with home and email easy during my stay. Unique touches everywhere. Did I mention it is Peaceful?! Finally, Super Host Amy was friendly, helpful, and very responsive to questions. This is my new go to when in the Appleton area!

review_text: I travel a considerable amount and have stayed in countless BnBs all over the globe. This is one of the best hidden gems where I have ever had the pleasure to stay. The host undersells the property. Amy has gone over and above in almost every aspect of this BnB. Extremely functional and convenient. Her interior decorating goes even further in making you feel comfortable and cozy. I stayed in late December, right after a decent snow. The driveway and walkways were perfectly kept (even upon my midnight arrival). If you are looking for a warm and cozy winter getaway for some R&R, this is your place. Imagine making a fire in the indoor fireplace, and drinking coffee while sitting in world's comfiest recliner. All while watching it snow onto the frozen river out of the window next to you. This is what paintings are made of. Would 10/10 recommend staying here.

Lovely house on the river.
The house has recently been re-decorated, so everything is shiny and new. I enjoyed sitting at the dining table, or at the table outdoors on the deck, and watching the river go by.
Loved ending my day with a kayak ride up the river.
The hosts have helpfully made a list of nearby grocery stores if you want to cook for yourself in the lovely kitchen, or nearby restaurants if you'd rather not cook.
The host was very responsive when I had a question.
I was concerned that road noise might be an issue, as maps show the house near a main road, but the house is down a slope from the road, and the road is not busy, so I never heard traffic noise. It was especially quiet at night.
A fabulous river getaway.
